content: I've just been looking at Backdrop's iCal calendar, and I see events on there that aren't on https://backdropcms.org/news/events... Is there a way we can automate the addition of iCal events on B.org, or should we embed the iCal calendar at the bottom of the Events page?
You seem to use Google for the iCal feed (not sure about the details of the B.org setup). Note, that's there's a "module for that": https://backdropcms.org/project/viewsicalexport

@indigoxela That module seems to create an iCal feed from Backdrop content, however in B.org's case, it seems the iCal calendar is the canonical source for events (I believe @jenlampton and @StPaulTim use/update that), and events are then manually added to B.org as necessary...

it seems the iCal calendar is the canonical source for events ... events are then manually added to B.org

I suspected that, I think it could get simplified.

  • add events on B.org only
  • create the feed with the module
  • subscribe to it with google calendar

Then you only have to create event content once. Just a suggestion :wink:

The iCal feed has a weekly event for the office hours (I suspect the original reason this calendar was setup was to remind Jen and Tim about this). This likely isn't required on B.org as a repeating event (there's already a mention of it somewhere), so maybe there can be 'hidden' events on B.org, but then all events are exported to iCal...?

maybe there can be 'hidden' events on B.org

That seems feasible with views. Not sure how big the effort would be and if it's worth it.
Or combine it, B.org events added only there and then subscribe to them with google cal, other events (not needed on B.org) still get added in google manually... Could be worth a try.
We could do it the other way around. No ral reason google calendar needs to be the source

it seems the iCal calendar is the canonical source for events

Well, this might be stretching things. I certainly have not consistently updated iCal with public events. For me, BackdropCMS is more canonical for public events, but for internal events like weekly meetings, I rely on iCal.

I'd be happy to see the management of events improved and for us to be more consistent.
